column4: Strange, I deleted the .compiz folder and restarted, but all my settings persist
Unless the settings are saved somewhere else
Oh, where is it stored?
Erm, that's the issue
The reason I'm deleting the settings is because I CAN'T SEE THE COMPIZ WINDOW
Apologies for caps.
Exactly
The window for compiz config and all that belongs to it isn't visible
It starts up, but I can't see it visibly
Wouldn't it be easier to delete the settings?
No
I really only have wobbly windows and desktop cube on
I'll just reset them when I restored everything.
Actually, if you don't have simple-ccsm installed, setting to None and back to Extra will delete your settings

here's what I did in detail. I opened up compiz, went to opacity, brightness, and saturation, went to windows settings under opacity, clicked the + icon, and chose the grab feature, grabbed the same window I was on, and clicked okay
I know
Then the window was still on my taskbar, but invisible
All's you have to do is get to gnome-appearance-properties>Visual Effects tab and set to None and back to whatever it's set at now
So edit the metacity I'm currently on?
And find the setting in it?
I'm going to tell you one last time. Go to System>Preferences>Appearance>Visual Effects tab and set to None
